hotspots.hotspot:
Chemical Energy

Chemical energy is stored in the bonds of molecules, such as this carbon dioxide molecule. When the atoms are joined to form a molecule, work is done to bond the atoms together. The amount of chemical energy in a substance depends on the types and arrangement of atoms in the molecule.

Nuclear Energy

Nuclear energy is associated with the nucleus of an atom. A large amount of energy holds the particles in the nucleus together. This energy can be released when an atom's nucleus breaks apart or when the nuclei of two atoms join together.

drops.drop: 1. Energy is stored in the bonds of molecules.
3. Total amount of energy from the movement of the atoms and molecules that make up matter.
4. Energy transferred from sun in form of electromagnetic waves.
5. Energy is associated with the nucleus of an atom.
6. Thermal energy stored in the Earth.
7. Energy of back and forth movements of ocean water.

multiple.question: If two snowballs of the same size and shape are placed at the top of the hill, the snowball that has more mass will have less potential energy?

matches.match: Nut sitting in a bowl on a table
Car speeding along a flat road

scene.instructions: When you are done, check your results by clicking 'Check Answers'.
scene.credits: (tr)Lauren Burke/Photographer's Choice RF/Getty Images, (bkgd)Image Source/Getty Images.

hotspots.hotspot: At the bottom of the hill, the hikers had no gravitational potential energy. All the energy they used to move up the hill came from the energy stored in the molecules of their bodies.
As they moved up the hill, the hikers' gravitational potential energy increased, because the hikers are farther from the surface.
At the top of the hill, the hikers now have gravitational potential energy, but no kinetic energy.
The hikers will convert gravitational potential energy into kinetic energy by moving back down the hill.

multiple.question: Chemical energy is a form of potential energy.
According to the second law of thermodynamics, closed systems tend to maintain the same order or to become more disordered.
Which of the following is an example of potential energy?
How can a rolling ball with less mass than a second ball have more kinetic energy?

answers.answer: The first ball could be rolling in a curved path.
The first ball could be smoother.
The first ball could be rolling faster.
The first ball could be larger.
Both balls must have the same kinetic energy because their masses are the same.

multiple.question: According to the laws of thermodynamics, why are energy conversions never 100% efficient?

answers.answer: Energy is always lost in the form of heat.
Energy is gained from other systems.
